intro: Mentha arvensis var. stenodonta, commonly known as narrow-leaved water mint, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and its ability to thrive in moist, shady environments. The plant produces small, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its aromatic leaves contain essential oils, which contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses. It is often found in wet meadows, stream sides, and other damp habitats.
